page.title: 07IRONBRIDGE GORGE MUSEUMS
page.content: The{Ironbridge Gorge Museum Trust}was first set up in 1967. The Trust was set up to care for all the old industrial exhibits. The museum is there to help people understand in a simple way about{Iron}and the way you produce it. Money they use comes from industry, charities and individuals. The main sites for tourists are {Blists Hill, Ironbridge Gorge, Museum {of Iron, Coalport, Jackfield and the {Severn Warehouse. The Museum Trust employs 300 people, 200 of whom are on Youth Training Schemes. In the future the Museum Trust is going to open up some new buildings, including Rosehill House one of the Darbys' homes. To open at Blists' Hill are a wrought iron works, the only one in the world, forge, Methodist chapel, locksmiths, surgery and a dame school.
